title: Young Mutton Busters A Rodeo Favorite
teaser: Kids between the ages of 5 and 7 are strutting their stuff on the mutton busting circuit -- where they see how long they can hang onto sheep.
contentencoded:
Kids between the ages of 5 and 7 are strutting their stuff at country fairs and on the rodeo circuit.

Across the Midwest, they’re competing in mutton busting competitions where they climb on woolly sheep and see how long they can hang on.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Luke Runyon of Harvest Public Media reports from a competition in Greeley, Colorado, where he followed the fortunes of one young competitor.

  • Harvest Public Media: Mutton busting a rodeo tradition for rough and tumble kids

Reporter

  • Luke Runyon, reporter for KUNC and Harvest Public Media. He tweets @LukeRunyon.
